intro: Phacelia canescens, commonly known as the silver phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Phacelia canescens is also valued for its role in attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
